headline.main: A HAPPY IRISHMAN.; Letter from John Mitchell.

docs.lead_paragraph: The long-expected narration of the eventful voyage of the Arctic-exploring ship Resolute has at length made its appearance -in England, illustrated by a chart of the voyage, several well-executed chromo-lithographs, and a number of wood cuts.
docs.snippet: The long-expected narration of the eventful voyage of the Arctic-exploring ship Resolute has at length made its appearance -in England, illustrated by a chart of the voyage, several well-executed chromo-lithographs, and a number of wood cuts.

headline.main: INTERESTING FROM KANSAS.; Efforts to prolong the Agitation-Support of Governor Walker by the Masses--Fugitive Slaves in Lawrence--A Bloodies Duel-Inaugural Message of the First Mayor of Lawrence. [OUR SPECIAL CORRESPONDENCE.]

docs.lead_paragraph: The leaders of the Lawrence insurrectionary movement and the agitators throughout the Territory generally, are laboring with all the resources they can muster to extend and perpetuate the partial excitement and irritation which recent events have stirred up in Kansas.

headline.main: QUARANTINE AFFAIRS.; Yellow Fever--Vessels at Quarantine, &c.

docs.lead_paragraph: The hints heretofore thrown out of intentions to dodge Quarantine by going to ports on the Sound, were not so far from the truth as some asserted. The following cases show a disposition to adopt that manouvre when it can be done without incurring too serious penalties.

headline.main: MRS. CUNNINGHAM.; Material Aid for Mrs. C.'s Family and a Purse for the Blessed Baby. Personalities and Curiosities of the Case. MRS. CUNNINGHAM. THE INMATES OF NO. 31 BOND-STREET Dr. Uhl and the Physicians' Oath No Comfort for Quiduiuncs in the Academy, Personalities and Curiosities of the Case. CATLIN IN THE TOMBS.

docs.lead_paragraph: The developments of the last two days in the Burdell Baby Case, are not of great importance. Mrs. CUNNINGHAM still remains at No. 31 Bond-street, closely confined to her bed, the latter more from choice than from necessity. She is undoubtedly an invalid, suffering from cucumbers and chagrin, and to-day will as undoubtedly be able to move, if she is bailed, or compelled to move, if she is not.

docs.lead_paragraph: By the arrival of the Indian at Quebec from Liverpool, yesterday, we have four days later intelligence from Europe. The most important of the news is that which relates to China and India. The British forces had destroyed the Chinese fleet, and Canton was in the power of the English. There had been an advance in ?? in consequence.

headline.main: Seduction, Abortion, and Death in Chicago.

docs.lead_paragraph: Some of the particulars of a dark and wicked transaction, which has recently taken place in this city, have been revealed to us through the medium of legal investigations which are now in progress. It appears that the death of a oung woman has been caused by an attempt made upon her to produce abortion, and that parties who have occupied respectable positions in the community are implicated in the dreadful crime.

headline.main: NEW-YORK CITY.; A Voice from Staten Island. The Board of Metropolitan Police Commissioners. The City Churches During the Summer Vacation. FEMALE IMPOSTOR ARRESTED. COURT OF COMMON PLEAS. SERIOUS ROBBERY. The Superintendent of the New-Haven Railroad.

docs.lead_paragraph: The Board of Metropolitan Police Commissioners met yesterday morning, but not publicly nor formally. The matter of filling the vacancy in the Board was considered until after 1 o'clock, when they separated, without having united upon a candidate. They will meet again to day.
docs.snippet: The Board of Metropolitan Police Commissioners met yesterday morning, but not publicly nor formally. The matter of filling the vacancy in the Board was considered until after 1 o'clock, when they separated, without having united upon a candidate....

docs.lead_paragraph: Death of Alexander Boyd-Proceedings by the Coroner--The Post-Mortem Examination, ?. Mr. ALEXANDER BOYD, who was shot on Tuesday morning last, by two burglars, who had broken into his residence, at No. 12 West Eighteenth-street, died about 6 o'clock yesterday morning. He remained conscious to the last, and by signs bade farewell to those who stood by his bedside.
